description: Reads and writes files and devices. (Cannot read/write disk devices in Windows 95/98/ME or Win32s.) For example useful to write a floppy image file on a hard disk to a physical floppy in Windows NT.
summary:
Examples for Windows NT:
rawcopy -m diskimage.img \\.\A:
  Writes a diskette image file called "diskimage.img" to a physical diskette
  in drive A:. (File extension .img is just an example, sometimes
author: Olof Lagerkvist
